@Millar_Colin This was also in a season in which Chelsea finished tenth, Liverpool eight and Leicester won the title, so United underperformed as well. And City's squad featured Hart, a declining Zabaleta, Sagna, Clichy and Fernando
@Millar_Colin City finished ahead of United on goal difference in 2015/16 and were far weaker defensively and in midfield compared to now. Really don't think the gap was that pronounced at the time
@thehuwdavies But the least talented of the two as well
@LiamPaulCanning He should take his chances, certainly. But it's very hard when he's largely living off scraps. United pretty much non-existent in an attacking sense bar that chance
